item.title: Doom: The Dark Ages’ Best New Feature Opens a Pandora’s Box id Can’t Close
item.description:
Doom: The Dark Ages is id Software's latest project in the largely successful new era of the iconic shooter IP, with the game's release on May 15 allowing fans to finally see what the project has to offer. From the very outset of the title's announcement, it always seemed as if The Dark Ages had something truly unique and memorable to offer to the franchise, with the game's setting allowing its nature as a prequel to still offer a wide range of fresh gameplay and narrative experiences to the series.

The medieval imagery and inspiration within Doom: The Dark Ages is quite unlike anything the mainline franchise has seen before, with id Software smartly using this basis to influence a variety of new combat and exploration mechanics that give the project a distinct identity and level of charm away from its predecessors. As many fans noted in the early gameplay footage for the title, The Dark Ages ' setting has also lent itself to an expanded arsenal of fresh weapons at the Slayer's disposal, with the Shield Saw standing out as one of the most useful and instantly iconic. With how integral the Shield Saw is to The Dark Ages ' combat, it seems like the weapon will surely appear in future Doom projects, even if not in the same capacity as its major role in the recent release.

Doom: The Dark Ages' Shield Saw Does Well to Compete with the Franchise's Iconic Weaponry

The Shield Saw is introduced to players early on in Doom: The Dark Ages , and for good reason. It quickly becomes apparent that the Shield is one of the major ways that the player can take control of the expansive battle arenas of the title, with id Software stressing how The Dark Ages has some of the highest levels of enemy density that the franchise has ever seen. Using the Shield Saw's ramming ability, players can target groups of enemies and lunge long distances into the thick of combat, complete with an explosion of power that can annihilate large groups of Doom 's weaker demon types.

Conversely, the Shield also serves a traditional defensive purpose, being able to block damage during tense situations and even parry certain powerful attacks back at enemies, with the Shield Saw being the major component in The Dark Ages ' new parrying system. When upgraded to its saw form early on in the game's story, the Shield can additionally be thrown in a deadly arc, stunning tankier enemies while ripping through the metallic shielding of certain pesky demons such as Shield Soldiers.

The Shield also has a wide range of potential upgrades that can be worked towards in Doom: The Dark Ages , allowing the player to choose from a range of offensive or defensive pathways.

As if the wide utility of the Shield Saw was not enough to win over the hearts of players, it is essentially an ever-present part of the Slayer's arsenal due to its nature as an off-hand weapon. The Shield Saw can be dual-wielded alongside the vast majority of Doom: The Dark Ages ' weapons, meaning players are constantly open to using the Shield to its full extent throughout most gameplay contexts.

Combination Weapons Like the Shield Saw Could Find a Consistent Place in Doom's Future

This puts the Shield Saw in a unique position compared to most of the weaponry that players have become familiar with throughout the storied history of the Doom franchise, making the Shield a difficult piece of equipment to ignore for id Software going forward. While the series has, of course, proven that it has a winning formula without the presence of an off-hand weapon like the Shield Saw, it seems as if a future project would feel emptier without the presence of something that at least somewhat emulates the utility that the Shield Saw possesses.

The Shield Saw seems like a logical extension of past melee weapons like Doom Eternal 's Crucible sword, with its improved ease of access and larger defensive capabilities opening up a world of combat opportunities for the franchise. While the IP should always strive to innovate on its formula and introduce fresh equipment, the most promising additions deserve to play a future role, and it is clear to see that the Shield Saw is more than deserving of this going forward.

item.title: Take-Two CEO Explains Why GTA 6 Was Delayed
item.description:
Summary

  • GTA 6 was delayed to meet the creative vision without limitations.
  • Take-Two CEO explains delay decision was to support Rockstar Games' pursuit of perfection.
  • The CEO feels confident about the new release date for GTA 6.

Take-Two Interactive, the parent company of Rockstar Games, has shared that GTA 6 was delayed to fulfill the developer's creative vision "with no limitations" and has also reassured fans about the game's release date. As the long-overdue sequel to 2013's GTA 5 and the next chapter in Rockstar's widely acclaimed open-world crime saga, GTA 6 has been one of the most highly anticipated games in recent years.

Ever since being officially confirmed for the first time in 2022, the new Grand Theft Auto has constantly been on the radar of enthusiasts, leading to lots of hype and speculation in the process. The sheer excitement and fanfare around the project could be assessed by the record-breaking launch of its announcement trailer and the virtually countless fan theories that have followed. After initially targeting a 2025 release, GTA 6 was delayed to May 26, 2026, by Rockstar Games to meet the desired game quality. Now, the American publisher's owner has also spoken about the decision to push the game further back and explained what led to the same.

In an interview with IGN, Take-Two Interactive CEO Strauss Zelnick shared how getting closer to the completion of "a title that’s seeking perfection" can reveal the need for "continued polish." Reflecting on GTA 6 's case that bore immediate market repercussions, he explained that the call to delay the title was made because those in charge thought "a small amount of incremental time" could help Rockstar Games fulfill its vision for the game without any limitations. He continued, "And I supported, of course, that approach." Despite the postponement of GTA 6 , Zelnick expressed his confidence in the slate for FY 2025-26, saying that he felt "really good." However, at the same time, he admitted that such delays "pain" him as well, while also stating that "the most important thing" was to back the devs "in their search for perfection."

Take-Two CEO Talks About the GTA 6 Delay

Apart from revealing the thought process behind the delay, Zelnick spoke about GTA 6 's newly revealed release date in a reassuring manner. Reflecting on Rockstar's track record, the Take-Two chief emphasized that, when it comes to meeting specific release dates, the devs have "been very good about reaching it." Notably, the publisher's last major release, Red Dead Redemption 2 , also faced delays but eventually rolled out once a specific date on the calendar was locked down.

Even though the GTA 6 delay has left a sizable hole in Take-Two's 2025 release slate, the forthcoming months are still filled with multiple big launches for the AAA gaming giant. Mafia: The Old Country in August and Borderlands 4 in September mark two of the biggest game launches still to come from the 2K parent in 2025.

item.title: Hideo Kojima Has a Contingency Plan for When He Dies
item.description:
Summary

  • Kojima has a contingency plan for Kojima Productions and its games in case of his passing.
  • Kojima created a USB drive with future game ideas after considering his mortality during the pandemic.
  • Kojima's illness made him confront his mortality, leading him to worry about the future of Kojima Productions.

Hideo Kojima apparently has a plan for Kojima Productions and its games in the event that he passes away. The legendary mind behind games like Death Stranding 2 and Metal Gear Solid has apparently been giving his own mortality some thought, and it's led to this particular contingency plan.

Despite now being 61 years old, Hideo Kojima isn't showing any significant signs of slowing down, with multiple projects he's leading or co-developing currently in the pipeline. Many fans are eagerly awaiting Death Stranding 2 , as well as the mysterious OD horror game project, and stealth action game Physint . While Kojima intends to keep making games, he's also given some thought to what will happen when his journey comes to an end.

In a conversation with Edge Magazine (via VideoGamesChronicle), Kojima discussed his mortality and what he has done to ensure the future of his ideas. He explained that he created a USB drive with files on it containing the ideas he has thought up for future games, and he gave it to his personal assistant. He says that it's kind of like a will for him, and that he thought that "perhaps they could continue to make things after I'm gone at Kojima Productions." Kojima went on, openly professing worry over the idea that Kojima Productions might shift to only managing existing IP after his passing. Considering that Kojima has no shortage of wild ideas for games, it's fairly easy to imagine that he wouldn't want his ideas to be lost or left unrealized.

Kojima Has Had Mortality On His Mind Since The Pandemic

Some might find it surprising to hear Kojima bringing up this subject so openly, especially since he's only 61. However, it seems that he's been thinking of his mortality since a brush with a severe illness during the pandemic. He noted during the interview that he had become extremely sick during that period of time, and even needed to have surgery. Prior to that, he hadn't felt his age, and figured he'd keep making games for as long as he lived. However, the illness made him confront his mortality and wonder how much time he had left, even after recovering. It would seem that Kojima felt a significant impact from the pandemic, with COVID-19 even leading to Kojima rewriting Death Stranding 2 .

For many fans, the notion of a gaming industry with no Hideo Kojima in it is harrowing. He's been a fundamental part of the industry since 1987, when he headed the original Metal Gear game for Konami, and his influence has been felt ever since. With any luck, Kojima will be around for many years yet to come and will get to create the ideas he currently has on that USB stick instead of having to leave it to others.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and God of War Prove Fantasy Games Are Perfect for Grounded Family Drama
item.description:
The following contains major story spoilers for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 ​​​​​​.

Not all fantasy games rely on grand prophecies or world-ending catastrophes to create emotional weight; some of the most powerful stories in the genre are rooted in something far more personal: family. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and God of War may come from different corners of the gaming world—one a French surrealist RPG, the other an action series steeped in Norse mythology—but both use their fantastical settings to frame grounded, deeply human family conflicts.

Each game presents a tale of complicated parental relationships, grief, and identity. These themes unfold not through exposition-heavy lore but through actions, choices, and conversations between characters who feel heartbreakingly real. In Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , the player follows Maelle and the rest of the Dessendre family as they endure the literal and metaphorical unraveling of their world after a traumatic loss. God of War focuses on Kratos and his son Atreus navigating a dangerous world, and each other, after Atreus' mother's death.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Shows Grief’s Weight

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 explores the emotional and psychological cost of loss in a way few RPGs attempt. The Dessendre family doesn’t just endure a tragic event; they’re shaped, fractured, and sometimes undone by it. Maelle’s role in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 especially exemplifies how grief can morph into obsession, guilt, or stubborn denial, especially by the end. Her choices are not about saving the world in the traditional sense, but about the inability to move on. That emotional authenticity is reflected in how the game presents its branching endings, and Sandfall lets players sit with the consequences of their choices, much like real life.

What’s most notable is how the game never tries to undercut its emotional beats with irony or over-explanation. When Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's Aline clings to her own version of events, it’s heartbreaking because players know how much she's lost and how she's suffered for it. The surreal visuals may suggest fantasy, but every emotional conflict in the game could easily be found in a family living room. It's this grounded realism that has resonated with over two million players, proving that personal stakes can be just as compelling as epic ones.

God of War Builds Real Conflict from Mythology

When God of War rebooted in 2018, it moved away from revenge-fueled spectacle and leaned into a more intimate story of Kratos' fatherhood. Once a symbol of unchecked violence, Kratos became a man attempting to raise his son with restraint and wisdom—qualities he himself lacked for much of his life. Meanwhile, Atreus is more than a child following in his father’s footsteps; he’s someone wrestling with the knowledge of what he is and what he might become. The father-son dynamic becomes the true driving force of the narrative, not just a subplot.

As God of War Ragnarok expands the scope, it also deepens the exploration of broken familial ties. Odin’s manipulative parenting, especially in his interactions with God of War 's Thor and Baldur, offers a darker mirror to Kratos’ struggle. Odin isn’t just a villain, he’s a cautionary tale about what happens when power and control override care and honesty. The game doesn’t preach about fatherhood, but it builds its world and character arcs around the consequences of generational trauma.

In interviews (especially with one via Time), God of War 's Cory Barlog has cited his own experiences as a parent as a major influence on the reboot's tone and themes, anchoring myth in everyday truths.

By balancing violent encounters with quiet, emotionally charged moments (like God of War 's Atreus and Kratos sharing a fireside talk or struggling to understand each other's motives), the series achieves a kind of narrative texture few action games attempt. It proves that gods and monsters are great, but the real drama happens when family members try to reach one another across the emotional void.

Future Games Should Learn From Clair Obscur and God of War

While there are currently no announcements for a follow-up, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 's milestone success suggests that more emotionally grounded narratives in fantastical worlds would be welcome. Whether it’s a direct sequel or a spiritual successor, the groundwork has been laid for this approach to become a creative signature for Sandfall. Should it continue in this direction, Sandfall may even benefit from following the trajectory of God of War , which showed how expanding scope doesn’t have to mean sacrificing intimacy; it can instead offer new angles on family conflict.

A potential future Clair Obscur game could further explore generational relationships, much like God of War Ragnarok did by bringing in multiple parent-child dynamics.

item.title: Fortnite Leaks Tease Chapter 6 Season 3 Battle Pass Skin
item.description:
Summary

  • Fortnite's Chapter 6 was paused for a Star Wars-themed mini-season before the upcoming expected Season 3.
  • Leaks hint at a superhero-themed Season 3 Battle Pass with a chameleon skin, offering potential customization opportunities.

Fortnite 's upcoming Battle Pass won't be available until the second week of June, but leakers have already found hints and images of what appears to be a chameleon-like character skin. Fortnite Chapter 6 was unexpectedly interrupted at the start of May. While some gamers were expecting Season 3 to start immediately after Season 2 came to an end, that did not happen; instead, the chapter was put on hold for a month to make way for Galactic Battle, a Star Wars -themed mini-season.

Until June 7, the Battle Royale island is riddled with Star Wars weapons and characters and themed locations. During this time, players must try their hardest to complete a shorter Battle Pass and unlock all of its V-Bucks and Star Wars cosmetics before the season ends. Currently, there are no reasons to believe that Chapter 6 Season 3 won't be the next season, so gamers are hopeful that they will once again return to standard season lengths, which will feature a more rewarding Battle Pass with more V-Bucks and cosmetics.

Rumors suggest that the next Fortnite season will be superhero-themed, as survey skins and boons found in the game files have focused on this theme recently. Loolo_WRLD and andredotuasset, two Fortnite leakers, have revealed that one of the codenames found in the game files is a chameleon-like character, expected to be part of the Chapter 6 Season 3 Battle Pass as a skin, which has left fans with mixed feelings, since it does not look much like a superhero - at least at first glance.

Chapter 6 Season 3 Might Feature a Chameleon Skin

A chameleon skin has been shown before in fan surveys, and their appearance does not look like a superhero at all. It looks like any standard gimmick character that Epic Games has added before. However, that doesn't mean that it won't have superhero-like alternative styles. There are various Peely skins in Fortnite , and they're quite versatile when it comes to their themes. There is a regular-looking Peely that's just an undressed banana, and then there's a spy Peely, a Ninja Peely, and quite a few variants that show how versatile skins can be in Fortnite .

Epic Games enjoys coming up with quirky skins and adding them to the Battle Pass, and they usually please fans who like to come up with sillier looks. And they fit Fortnite quite well, as it's a game that doesn't take itself too seriously. For example, Midas is one of the most serious characters in Fortnite , but he has a summer variant that completely changes his vibe. A chameleon skin adds endless possibilities in terms of alternative styles, especially when it comes to colors and textures. Gamers might have a great time using this skin in Creative fashion show islands and Battle Royale.
